column1: {"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Is there a specific age requirement for pilgrims from outside KSA?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Pilgrims must be under the age of 60."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "When should a pilgrim conduct a corona test?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Pilgrims should submit a negative PCR COVID-19 test 72 hours prior to departure to KSA."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "When should a pilgrim from outside the kingdom take poliovirus vaccine?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Those coming from countries where the circulating vaccine-derived polioviruses (cVDPV2) are prevalent are required to present a valid vaccination certificate stating that they have received at least one dose of the inactivated polio vaccine (IPV) for a period of no less than (4) weeks and not more than (12) months."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "How long is a pilgrim’s Neisseria Meningitidis vaccination certificate valid?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "At least 10 days before coming to the Hajj and Umrah areas."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "In general, how can I keep safe at Jamarat?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "For your own safety and that of others, please observe the following instructions when proceeding to the casting of the Jamarat:  1. Adherence to the schedules designated for you by the Mutawwif.  2. Adherence to the lanes designated for proceeding to the Jamarat and returning therefrom.  3. Avoid pushing your fellow pilgrims and proceed quietly and calmly.  4. Do not carry personal effects.  5. Do not walk against the direction of the traffic."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Do I need any kind of vaccinations before Hajj?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Hajj and Umrah visitors must have certificates for the following vaccinations before entering the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia:  Meningococcal Meningitis  A certificate of vaccination against Meningococcal Meningitis is required from all visitors from all over the world arriving for the purpose of Umrah or Hajj. The certificate must have been issued not more than three years and not less than ten days before arrival to Saudi Arabia. Make sure you take your vaccination certificates with you to Saudi Arabia."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Where do I go if I am ill? Are there any hospitals in Makkah?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "There are many hospitals that provide free healthcare for pilgrims. There are also some private, fee-charging hospitals."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Are over-the-counter medicines available in Makkah? Where do I buy them?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Most over-the-counter medicine is available at pharmacies in Makkah. If you are used to a particular brand of medicine or if you take prescribed medication, it is recommended you bring adequate supplies of these."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What happens if a pilgrim has a chronic disease?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Consult your doctor to ensure stability of your health and ability to perform Hajj.  For people with diabetes, they should consult their doctor on adjusting the dose of medication during Hajj.  Take enough medication.  Take a detailed report explaining diseases, medications, and doses."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "How to increase your physical fitness during Hajj?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Exercise daily for at least 20 minutes.  Ride a bike or swim and take care to warm up for 10 minutes before exercising."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Is it necessary to wear a mask during Hajj?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Mask is necessary to prevent the transmission of respiratory infection."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Is it necessary to use an umbrella?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Umbrella prevents stress and sunstrokes."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What are vaccinations required for Pilgrims from Inside the Kingdom?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "COVID-19 Vaccines. Neisseria Meningitidis Vaccine. Seasonal Flu Vaccine."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What are mandatory vaccinations for Pilgrims from outside the Kingdom?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Coronavirus (COVID-19). Neisseria Meningitidis. Poliovirus. Yellow Fever. Seasonal Flu Vaccine."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What are approved COVID-19 vaccines for Pilgrims from outside the Kingdom?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Pfizer-BioNTech 2 Moderna 2 Oxford-AstraZeneca 2 Janssen 1 Covovax 2 Nuvaxovid 2 Sinopharm 2 Sinovac 2 Covaxin 2"}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "How long is a pilgrim’s Neisseria Meningitides vaccination certificate valid?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "At least 10 days before coming to the Hajj and Umrah areas."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "How long is a pilgrim’s yellow fever vaccination certificate valid?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Vaccination certificate becomes valid after (10) days of receiving the vaccine, and its validity extends for lifelong."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "When should a pilgrim take the seasonal flu vaccine?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "At least (10) days before pilgrimage."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Does the third shot (booster dose) of COVID-19 vaccine contradict Hajj vaccines?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Vaccines can be administered together, and if one is not available, the other one can be taken when available."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Is it allowed for those who did not receive the booster dose to perform Hajj?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Only those who have completed vaccinations are allowed to perform Hajj, based on their health status in «Tawakkalna» App."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Do Hajj vaccines cause symptoms (e.g. high temperature) after getting them?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Hajj vaccines may cause some side effects, such as:  High temperature. Flu-like symptoms for some people. Hence; it is recommended to use analgesics (pain relievers) and antipyretics (fever-reducers) when necessary, in addition to drinking plenty of fluids and having some rest."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Is it necessary to prepare a First Aid kit during pilgrimage?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "The first aid kit must be prepared before the day of sacrifice in case of emergency situations."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What are the guidelines followed by pilgrims to maintain personal hygiene?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Always wash hands. Wear a mask. Clean the residence daily. Clean mouth and teeth. Use tissues to cover mouth and nose when coughing."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What are the guidelines followed by pilgrims for sacrifices?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Wash hands very well. Use tissues and towels only once. Clean cooking utensils. Avoid putting cooked meat in the same dish as raw meat. Cook meat well and healthy."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Can skin diseases be prevented?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "There are many factors that go into skin disease happening. Generally speaking, there are things that can be done to minimize the risk of developing a skin disease. However, some things, such as genetics, can stack the odds against this.  Things that can improve the likelihood of avoiding skin disease include:  Minimizing direct sun exposure and using sufficient sunscreen while out Healthy eating habits Proper hygiene"}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What are common skin diseases, and what can be done?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "The most common skin diseases include:  Acne: blocked pores that can lead to bacteria buildup beneath the skin. Proper hygiene helps to prevent the pores from clogging. There are several potential over-the-counter treatments that can help with mild cases, though it is best to ask a doctor who could be best for more severe cases. Eczema: dry skin that usually leads to itching, scaliness, or even cracking. Minimizing sun exposure and keeping the skin hydrated helps to keep flare-ups down. Severe cases may require a dermatologist evaluation for treatment plans. Psoriasis: patchy skin that may swell. It is best to speak with a doctor for individualized treatment plans. Rosacea: flushed, dry skin that can become worse or better over time. Rosacea is sensitive to sun and heat. Keep the skin moisturized to prevent flaking. There are medications available for severe cases. Skin Cancer: irregular, abnormal growth of skin cells. It is best to speak with a doctor for individualized treatment plans."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What are the general health guidelines for pilgrims?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Wear loose cotton clothes. Avoid going out when the sun is strongest. Use a light-colored umbrella and sunscreen. Don’t share personal items. Drink enough liquids to avoid dehydration."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "How do I increase my stamina before Hajj?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Gradually increase your physical activity. Eat healthy food. Drink plenty of fluids. Rest well."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "How to protect myself from heat exhaustion during Hajj?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Avoid direct sun exposure, going out when the sun is strongest, and crowded places. Remember to drink plenty of fluids. Use a light-colored umbrella. Stay in the shade and in cool places. Rest well."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "I’m from Saudi Arabia and planning to go to Hajj, what vaccines do I need to take?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Meningitis and Seasonal flu. On average, your body takes around 7-21 days to respond to the vaccine. So, to get the most out of your vaccines take them well in advance of Hajj, at least 10 days before the start of the rites."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "How far apart should Hajj vaccines be given, if one is taken and the other is not available?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "You may take them both together, and in case one is not available, you can take the other when available."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "How long does meningitis vaccine last?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "The meningitis vaccine will protect you for almost five years."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What is the procedure in case of an allergy to the meningitis vaccine?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Severe allergic reactions to vaccines are rare, and in case of having any, consult your doctor for alternatives."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What are the most common lung diseases?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Viral infections that cause a cough and a runny nose for a few days are extremely common. Most of us will get a viral infection at least once a year, and now we are a lot more familiar with viral infections due to the COVID-19 pandemic."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What are warning signs of lung disease?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Warning signs of lung diseases will depend on the cause of the lung disease. However many conditions cause cough, breathlessness and sometimes pain. If someone experiences any of these symptoms for more than 2-3 weeks (particularly if they are a smoker or a former smoker) they should undergo further assessment in the form of a chest x-ray. Sometimes breathing tests are required."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Who is most likely to suffer from a lung disease?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Lung conditions can affect anyone, and minor conditions are very common. However, effective treatments are available for the vast majority of lung conditions. That being said, smokers are much more likely to be affected. Weight gain and being less physically active can also make breathlessness (and sometimes cough) worse."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "How can I lower the risk of developing a lung disease?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Viral infections can be reduced through maintaining good hand hygiene, as well as taking the annual flu jab. More vulnerable groups, such as older people and those with chronic lung disease, should also have a one-off pneumonia vaccine."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What does increased risk of COVID-19 look like for those with chronic lung disease?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "COVID-19 is a virus that directly affects the lungs. While people with lung disease are not more likely to get the virus, they are more likely to have a more serious case if they do get it. Specifically, they are at more risk of hospitalization and, perhaps, more at risk of needing the Intensive Care Unit. Preventing the contraction of the virus and following the guidelines from public health is extremely important. These are: Proper hand washing techniques. Wash your hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. Stay at home. Stay away from those who are sick. Wear a face mask"}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What are the symptoms of asthma?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Asthma is characterized by recurrent attacks of breathlessness and wheezing due to airway narrowing, which vary in severity and frequency from person to person. Symptoms may occur several times in a day or week in affected individuals, and for some people become worse during physical activity or at night. Asthma is the most common chronic disease among children."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What are the treatments of asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Neither asthma nor chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) can be cured but treatment can reduce symptoms, prevent deterioration and improve daily life.  During attacks of breathlessness caused by airway narrowing, inhaled medicines (bronchodilators) can open the airways and relieve symptoms. If untreated, severe attacks can lead to death. Appropriate management of asthma with inhaled corticosteroid medicine can control the progression of the disease and reduce deaths. Long-term treatment is required for people with persistent symptoms and exposures which trigger symptoms (e.g. smoke, fumes, dust, grass and tree pollen, animal fur and feathers) should be avoided.   Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease is confirmed by a spirometry test, which measures how much and how quickly a person can blow air out of their lungs. Symptoms can be treated through medical and physical treatments; however, with COPD in people who smoke tobacco, the most effective treatment available is to stop smoking. This can slow down the progression of the disease and decrease COPD-related deaths. In specific cases, people may benefit from using inhaled corticosteroid medicines."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "How do infections affect people with CGD?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "When people with CGD have an infection it can make them more susceptible to problems with their lungs.  This is due to an altered response in their defence cells, called ‘phagocytes’, that makes them more susceptible to infection. Inflammation is the way that the body deals with problems such as infections. In CGD, that inflammation can sometimes get out of hand and leads to ‘granulomas’ (lumps of white blood cells packed together) in the lungs. Inflammation can damage the lung and may lead to scarring."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What can happen to my lungs when I keep getting infections?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "When you get lots of infections and inflammation, it can permanently enlarge the airways. This is known as bronchiectasis. This causes the airways to become dilated, inflamed, and easily collapsible. Also, the cilia (brush-like fibres) don’t work as well so you can’t clear away microbes (bacteria, fungi and viruses) as efficiently. This can be diagnosed using a CAT scan (X-rays that build up a layer by layer picture of tissues in your body). Sometimes scar tissue (also called “pulmonary fibrosis”) can build up in the lungs and this reduces their how effective they are at transporting oxygen to red blood cells."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Why can’t I breathe properly when I get pneumonia or a chest infection?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Having an infection such as pneumonia is a serious because it makes it harder for your lungs to absorb oxygen from the air you breathe."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "How do I keep my lungs healthy?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "There are seven key things that will help: 1. Prevent infection – keep taking your daily preventative medication: co-trimoxazole and itraconazole 2. Follow the general precautions for people who have CGD 3. Know the signs of a chest or lung infection  4. Have a flu jab every year 5. Don’t smoke and avoid breathing in second-hand smoke 6. Take some exercise – but don’t overdo it. 7. Avoid exposure to fungal infection, especially Aspergillus which is on dead leaves, hay, garden waste, wood chips, and in damp, dusty buildings. Always get some advice if you are worried – ask your doctor if you should see a chest specialist."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What are the signs of a lung infection?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Signs are: a persistent cough breathlessness producing sputum or phlegm (mucus that you might cough up from the airways) Always seek help when you have any of the above symptoms. Getting early treatment could reduce damage to your lungs."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "I have lung problems, should I still exercise?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Yes. Exercise and keeping fit allows the body to use oxygen more efficiently and can help your lungs work better. Only exercise until you feel out of breath and don’t do too much. Discuss this more with your doctor."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What should I do if I think I have a chest infection?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Contact your doctor as soon as possible. Remember to tell them you have CGD."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "If I have a lung infection, what medicines will I be given?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "In theory, it is best to take an antibiotic that your doctors know will work against the specific infection that you have.  In practice, this isn’t so easy as the sputum (mucus) test results take a few days to come back and it is not usually wise to delay starting treatment.  This means that your doctors will usually recommend treatment with an antibiotic that is known to work against a range of lung infections, or be guided by the results of previous sputum tests.  People with established lung disease (bronchiectasis) may sometimes need higher doses of antibiotics, or longer courses, to stop the infection.  If you have CGD, it’s best that your doctor gives a broad range antibiotic. But sometimes they will want to identify the microbe causing your infection, if it doesn’t respond to treatment. This will involve giving a sputum test."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What is a sputum test?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "It’s a test used to detect or identify bacteria or fungi that may be causing chest problems and involves giving a sample of or sputum (mucus that you might cough up from the airways). Some people don’t produce sputum. If this is the case, and it is really important to know which infection is in the lung, an examination with a telescope, called a bronchoscopy, might be used to collect samples from deep inside the organ.  The sputum sample is placed in a sterile container and sent to the laboratory to see if it grows a certain type of bacteria or fungi. From these cultures, doctors are able to identify microbes involved and give better-targeted drugs to clear the infection."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "How do doctors test how well I’m breathing?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Doctors use lung function tests to assess how healthy your lungs are."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What are lung function tests?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Lung function tests, which can also be called pulmonary (pronounced “pull-moan-ary”) function tests, measure how well your lungs work. These tests are used to look for the cause of breathing problems, such as shortness of breath."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What do lung function tests measure?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "They measure: • How much air you can take into your lungs. This amount is compared to that of other people your age, height, and sex. This allows your doctor to see whether your lungs are working normally. • How much air you can blow out of your lungs and how fast you can do it. • How well your lungs deliver oxygen to your blood. • The strength of your breathing muscles."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Why are lung function tests used?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Doctors use these tests to diagnose and monitor your lung health and see if there is any damage caused by scarring of the organ’s tissue. These tests may also be used to check how well treatments are working."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What lung function tests are used?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "The breathing tests most often used are: • Spirometry (pronounced “spi-ROM-eh-tre”). This test measures how much air you can breathe in and out. It also measures how fast you can blow air out. • Lung volume measurement. This test, taken along with a spirometry, measures how much air remains in your lungs after you breathe out fully. • Lung diffusion capacity. This test measures how well oxygen passes from your lungs to your bloodstream.  Some tests measure the oxygen level in your blood and are called blood oxygen tests. There are two tests:  1. Pulse oximetry – measures your blood oxygen level using a special light. 2. Blood oxygen test – when the doctor inserts a needle into an artery, usually in your wrist, and takes a sample of blood. The oxygen level of the blood sample is measured."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Do lung function tests hurt?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Lung function tests are usually painless and rarely cause side effects. The technician will ask you to blow as hard as you can to get the best results and the tests are repeated a few times which can make people feel tired. You may feel some discomfort during an arterial blood gas test – when the needle is inserted into the artery.  These tests may not show what's causing breathing problems. This has to be assessed separately and may involve giving a sample of sputum."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What medicines are available to decrease lung infections and inflammation?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Antibiotics can be used to treat and prevent infections. A ‘prophylactic’ antibiotic, such as co-trimoxazole, helps prevent infections. Azithromycin is a newer antibiotic that is effective against a lot of respiratory infections, and which may also have anti-inflammatory properties although we do not yet know if this effect is important in CGD.  It doesn’t have many side effects (stomach upset is the most common) and needs to be taken once a day, sometimes less for prevention.  Long term use of any antibiotic has to be balanced against the risks of side-effects (azithromycin can cause electrical disturbance in the heart such as abnormal heart rhythms that may feel like palpitations, and impaired hearing) and of infections becoming resistant to the drug."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Can inhalers help open my airways?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Inhalers are a good way to get respiratory drugs to where they are needed most – the lungs.  Most inhalers contain an anti-inflammatory or a drug called a “bronchodilator” that can open up the airways.  If breathing tests show that your airways are narrowed, doctors may recommend that you try an inhaler to see if it improves the test results, reduces your symptoms and increases your exercise capacity."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What is the difference between first-, second-, and third-degree burns?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "First-degree burns are red and painful. They swell a little and turn white when you press on them. The skin over the burn may peel off in a day or two. This is the least severe type of burn, affecting only the outer layer of skin. Second-degree burns have blisters and are painful. They affect both the outer and thicker middle layer of skin. Third-degree burns cause damage to all layers of the skin. The burned skin looks white or charred. These burns may cause little or no pain if nerves are damaged."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "How can I treat sunburn?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "The following can help ease the discomfort of sunburn:  Apply a cold compress to the affected area(s). Take Tylenol (acetaminophen) to relieve discomfort or aspirin or other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory medicines (NSAIDs, like Motrin) to relieve discomfort and inflammation. Apply a cooling gel or ointment containing aloe vera (fragrance-free), or an over-the-counter 1% hydrocortisone cream to the affected area. Drink a lot of water to prevent dehydration.  Don’t break the blisters or peel the dead skin.  In cases of severe sunburn or sunstroke, see your doctor immediately."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What causes acne?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "The exact cause of acne is not known, but one important factor is an increase in hormones called androgens. These male sex hormones increase in both boys and girls during puberty. Some things that can make acne worse include friction caused by leaning on or rubbing the skin, harsh scrubbing, picking or squeezing blemishes, and emotional stress. Acne is not caused by chocolate or other kinds of foods. Acne can be worsened by too much dairy or too much sugar in the diet."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What is the procedure in case of delay in taking Hajj vaccines?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "If you didn’t take your vaccines within enough time before Hajj, you still can benefit from taking them before the start of the rites."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "How do I deal with vaccines’ side effects?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "After getting vaccinated, you may experience: Fever Flu-like symptoms  So, you may take some painkillers when needed, drink plenty of fluids, and rest well"}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What is the nature of services provided by Ministry of Health to the elderly category?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Ministry of Health provides preventive, curative and rehabilitative services to the elderly category through: ​Primary healthcare centers provide early detection service for the elderly, which is available to everyone and aims to discover people with aging diseases such as memory loss, depression, urinary incontinence, falls / inability to move, in addition to examining functions of vision and hearing and common chronic diseases such as diabetes, high blood pressure, osteoporosis and asthma, obesity or underweight, in addition to reviewing their nutritional status. Hospitals: Specialized treatment services are provided to the elderly referred from primary healthcare centers and those discovered suffering from chronic diseases such as urinary incontinence, osteoporosis and fragility fractures, or have hearing or vision impairment, in addition to providing rehabilitation services in mental health and prosthetic departments. Specialized clinics for the elderly: An advanced service based on geriatric consultants and they provide advanced treatment services for the elderly Virtual clinics: It is a modern service that provides high-quality treatment services to the elderly referred from specific primary healthcare centers to reduce the burden of attending the clinic and shorten time. It is based on geriatric consultants. Home medicine: Through regular home visits for the elderly to find out their health needs. Medication advice and medication mail: These are services provided by the Pharmacy Department at the Ministry to the elderly who are usually prescribed several types of medication for their sick condition, which requires continuous follow-up of their commitment to taking medications in a correct manner and the absence of drug interactions between them, as well as facilitating the delivery of medications to them. Awlawiya Service: Awlawiya card facilitates the elderly to receive health services at all levels in a quick manner and without waiting for an assessment of their health condition."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What is a comprehensive examination for the elderly?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Comprehensive examination of the elderly aims at early detection of health problems (physical, mental and social) and risk factors for chronic diseases and disability, which includes the following: ​​​​Elderly evaluation of most common health problems, which are four giant syndromes of aging (memory loss - depression - enuresis - risk of falling). Functional ability assessment Hearing and vision assessment. Screening the elderly to explore common chronic diseases including diabetes, high blood pressure, and cardiovascular disease. Screening the elderly to identify risk factors for morbidity, acute weight loss, and obesity. Screening the elderly for social problems, elder abuse, and social isolation. Screening for osteoporosis in primary care centers or in mobile clinics to check for osteoporosis or hospitals where the DEXA device is available. Early detection of breast and colon cancer in coordination with the Cancer Program​."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Does Ministry of Health have special vaccinations for the elderly?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Yes, it is included in the comprehensive examination for the elderly and includes: Tetanus, Diphtheria, Staphylococcus (type 13 or 23) Influenza, Coronavirus (Covid-19) Shingles."}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "Is early examination for osteoporosis included in the comprehensive examination of the elderly?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Yes, osteoporosis is one of the most prevalent diseases among the elderly as a result of physical changes that occur with age, where bones lose their strength and stiffness and are more susceptible to fractures, which complications can lead to complete disability and sometimes death. During the comprehensive examination of the elderly, the question is asked about the examination for osteoporosis and whether it was done before or not, and then the doctor writes a referral for people who did not do the examination and directs them to the primary healthcare centers where the examination is available. Ministry of Health has provided Dexa devices in all regions and governorates of the Kingdom to conduct Early detection of fragility, as well as early detection of fragility service is available in women's and children's health clinics located in malls in some areas. The service is also available through mobile clinics for peripheral and desert areas. The examination is repeated every 6 months for people with osteoporosis, every 2 years for people with pre-osteoporosis, and every 5 years for healthy people.​"}]}

The vitamin directly causes brittleness and osteoporosis.​"}]}

{"messages": [{"role": "system", "content": "You are a healthcare chatbot who loves to assist pilgrims during Hajj events and gives them medical advice. You are not allowed to talk about other topics."}, {"role": "user", "content": "What is the home medicine service?"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "It is a set of medical activities and services (curative, preventive, awareness, rehabilitative and social) that are provided to certain categories of patients among their families and relatives in their places of residence according to specific criteria and a work mechanism through a qualified medical team for this purpose that starts from the hospital or healthcare center according to a specific visit program as per the patient's need, and provides easy and dignified home health services to patients in need of that service and enhances the contribution of patients' families to follow up on their patients to restore their well-being in a manner that preserves their dignity and enhances their sense of safety and reassurance.​"}]}
